result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer J. Lafernier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possession of Burglarious Tools, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to set up a payment plan with the probation agent to make regular monthly payments towards restitution.   

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, the victims, their businesses or their employees.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Write a letter of apology to the victims, if agent recommends.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody and with Attorney Sebion.  State recommends.  6 months jail.  14CF137.  Count 4.  10-12 mo.  Concurrent to Count 3 and 15CF2.  15CF2- 6 months concurrent with 14CF137.  Concurrent with sentence in Trempealeau County case.  Judgment for unpaid court costs and restitution.  Attorney Sebion requests following agent's recommendation.  Allow her to serve in Trempealeau County.  Defendant elected to exercise her right to allocution.  Court ordered:  14CF137:  Count 3 six months, Count 4 twelve months, concurrent to each other and with 15CF2 and the Trempealeau County case.   15CF2: six months, concurrent to 14CF137 and the Trempealeau County sentence.  Credit for 110 days.   Judgment for unpaid court costs and restitution.  May serve in Trempealeau Co.  May have Huber, according to jail rules.

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Carly Sebion for Attorney Layland.  Defendant plead no contest to counts 3 and 4.  Remaining counts dismissed and read in.  Court reviews plea questionnaire, consitutional rights and elements with the Defendant.  She understood.  Felony and deportation warnings given. Stipulate to a factual basis.  Court finds that the defendant has entered her plea and waived her constititional rights freely, knowlingly, and intelligently.  Court finds a factual basis.  Found guilty as plead to.  Joint rec.  probation.  3 years on felony.  2 years on misd counts.  No contact with victims.  Rest + surcharge.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant elects to exercise her right to allocution.  Court orders:  sentence withheld.  Probation ordered.  3 years on felony.  2 years on misd counts, concurrent.  No contact with victims , their businesses or employees.  Rest + surcharge.  Pay monthly through probation.  Set up payment plan with agent.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC.  LOA to each victim, if agent recommends.

This bond includes case 14CF137 and 15CF02:  Report for booking on case 15CF02.   Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Moe's Hardware or/and Nick's Pawn Store Black River Falls WI.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
